message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class ExtractStrings {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String s = "social network such as '''[http://www.facebook.com Facebook]''', '''[http://www.twitter.com Twitter]''' and '''[http://www.tumblr.com tumblr]'''";
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(s, "'''[ ]'''", false);
        while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            String token = st.nextToken();
            if (token.startsWith("http")) {
                System.out.println(token);
            }
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class in Java is used to break a string into tokens. In this code, we are using the StringTokenizer to break the string into tokens using the delimiters '''[ ]'''. We then check if the token starts with "http" to ensure we are only printing the URLs and the associated names. This way, we can extract the parts of the string that are wrapped in the specified delimiters.
